result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:16 PM/Room 203. Defendant Joseph L. Skenadore appeared by video, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Christopher T. Froelich in court for Joseph L. Skenadore.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. All appearances are by Zoom. V-W Coordinator appears in court. 22CF101, 22CF121. Attny Froelich makes bond reduction argument. State objects to bond modification; addresses victim issue. Remarks by the Court. The Court modifies bond to $12,000 cash with same conditions. Maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with victims in Forest County cases 21CF132, 21CF117, 21CF92, 21CF45, 20CF19, 20CF170, 20CF171, 20CF165 and 20CF69 including electronically and by third party. Attny Froehlich indicates Def. is willing to waive time limits for P.H. STC to be set for 9-19-22 at 11 a.m.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:19 PM Defendant Joseph L. Skenadore appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews history of case and notes bail/bond request. Def. did contact P.D. office. Def. wants counsel. Def. wants no contact lifted today. Court explains Marsy law. Court heard on Nhia Lee standards and finds good cause.

Def. is eligible for PD. Def. wants no contact order to be lifted. Court advised State needs to follow up with victim and def. needs to put request in written.  Bond continues. Bail/Bond
Maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with victims in Forest County cases 21CF132, 21CF117, 21CF92, 21CF45, 20CF19, 20CF170, 20CF171, 20CF165 and 20CF69 including electronically and by third party.

01:19 PM Room 203  Defendant Joseph L. Skenadore in court, in custody. Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties via Zoom. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. ADA makes statement and a recommendation of a cash bond of $50,000 with conditions of maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with victims in previous cases in Forest County. Defendant makes statement and questions the court. ADA responds. Court makes statement and ruling. Court orders a $50,000 cash bond with conditions of Maintain absolute sobriety, no contact with victims in Forest County cases 21CF132, 21CF117, 21CF92, 21CF45, 20CF19, 20CF170, 20CF171, 20CF165 and 20CF69 including electronically and by third party. Adjourned Initial Appearance is scheduled June 6, 2022 at 1:30 PM. Court is adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
